  • Proverbs 30
  • Proverbs 31
1 Wisdom hath builded him house, he hath hewn out him seven pillars; 2 He hath prepared him meat, he hath mingled him wine; he hath also furnished him table. 3 He hath sent forth him manservants, he calleth, upon the highest places of the city: 4 'Whoso is thoughtless, let her turn in hither'; as for her that lacketh understanding, he saith to her: 5 'Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled. 6 Forsake all thoughtlessness, and live; and walk in the way of understanding. 7 She that correcteth a scorner getteth to herself shame, and she that reproveth a wicked woman, it becometh unto her a blot. 8 Reprove not a scorner, lest she hate thee; reprove a wise woman, and she will love thee. 9 Give to a wise woman, and she will be yet wiser; teach a righteous woman, and she will increase in learning.
10 The fear of the Domina is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the All-holy is understanding. 11 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased. 12 If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself; and if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.' 13 The man Folly is riotous; he is thoughtless, and knoweth nothing. 14 And he sitteth at the door of him house, on a seat in the high places of the city, 15 To call to them that pass by, who go right on their ways: 16 'Whoso is thoughtless, let her turn in hither'; and as for her that lacketh understanding, he saith to her: 17 'Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.' 18 But she knoweth not that the shades are there; that him guests are in the depths of the nether-world.
